files.README.md:
# Zed Follow Plugin for Claude Code

Auto-open files in [Zed editor](https://zed.dev) as Claude Code reads, edits, or writes them. Files are added to your current workspace buffer, so you can see all changes in one place.

## Installation

```bash
# Add the marketplace
/plugin marketplace add joa23/claude-zed-follow

# Install the plugin
/plugin install zed-follow@joa23
```

That's it! Files will now auto-open in Zed as Claude works.

## Disable

```bash
# Uninstall to disable
/plugin uninstall zed-follow@joa23
```

## Requirements

- [Zed editor](https://zed.dev) with CLI installed (`zed` command available)
- [jq](https://jqlang.github.io/jq/) for JSON parsing

### Install dependencies (macOS)

```bash
# Zed CLI - install from Zed: Cmd+Shift+P â†’ "cli: install"

# jq
brew install jq
```

## How it works

The plugin uses a `PostToolUse` hook that triggers after Claude Code's `Read`, `Edit`, or `Write` tools complete. It:

1. Extracts the file path from the tool input
2. Opens the file in Zed using `zed --add` (adds to current workspace buffer)
3. Jumps to the line number if available

## Local Development

Test locally without installing:

```bash
claude --plugin-dir ~/projects/claude-zed-follow
```
